title: Is Kuliza Technologies a good company to start as a fresher? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A...........as of now Kuliza tech. is an Indian start up having some mind blowing persons behind it and totally a customer oriented organization.......may be like with any other start Up...you have to work extra bit and put your self completely into a rigorous "and fun loving way of learning " way to produce result to make life more fast as per the motto of company i.e:We bring great ideas to life faster............also as company resolved to  help craft WEB & MOBILE APPS 							THAT SOLVE COMPLEX BUSINESS PROBLEMS hence you will get to touch different technologies along with challenges to meet up in form of your customer demand but as being an start up it will hone you in every aspect. Your joining must also subjected to remuneration offered(if more than 15L-dude join it) but if it's like a avg. prevailing for new comers into IT industry......N if you don't have any opportunity from any BIG SHOT....than think twice to join as you are only going to work there but if you have any other Plans to accomplish, May be you won't get enough time there......as in IT industry It matters where you have started from......from a BIG SHOT or from a NEW one in market.......it will decide you elevation in next couple of years and may be when you gonna switch the job( BIG NAME HELPS)........but still Kuliza have a decent Customer base as per their web-site.Do some research there also:http://www.kuliza.com/Best of luck for future.

I started my career with Kuliza itself and let me tell it is perhaps one of the best possible companies to start your career with. I joined in Feb 2013 as an intern, converted into full time employee in June 2014 and stayed till September 2013. Though my stay is very short (8 months), the things learnt there made me what I am today. Before joining Kuliza in February 2013, I had actually given up on pursuing a full time engineering career after my graduation. I had a very good percentile in CAT (~99%) and had offers from all the new IIMs and MDI (I had not applied to any school apart from IIMs, FMS and MDI). By the time I completed my internship, I was thoroughly enjoying tech and felt I could make a career out of it. Also, I didn't want to join anything less than IIM ABC. But I could have the courage to make that decision of rejecting the offers from dream colleges for many because I felt equipped enough to make a career in tech. I'd highly recommend anyone to just grab the opportunity.
